III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Intervention Standards and Prohibitions
Section CCI Rule 400.4158
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
1

intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 2/13/25, a youth was upset and started destroying stuff in their
bedroom. A staff member grabbed the youth's wrist, and the
youth struck the staff member in the head with a book. The staff
member then punched the youth in the arm and stomach. The
youth was observed with a small bruise on the upper right arm.
Investigation Interviews:
On 2/14/2025 Youth A was interviewed at Christ Child House
(CCH) during an unannounced visit. Youth A reported that he was
breaking items in his room because he was upset and Staff 1 hit
him with his hand and left a bruise on his arm. He also reported
he told Staff 2 but she did not believe him. Youth A pointed to a
small mark/bruise on his arm. He denies that he requested or was
seen by a nurse or doctor after the incident.
On 2/14/2025 Youth B was interviewed at CCH during an
unannounced visit. Youth B reported Staff 1 is “over the top” and
described that as Staff 1 making fun of him everyday and “doing
too much” during restraints. He stated Staff 1 likes to joke a lot
and will tell him that he can’t be an athlete and talks about his
hygiene. Youth B also reported that Staff 1 hit Youth A during a
restraint yesterday. He confirmed that he did not see Staff 1 hit
Youth A, but was told by Youth A that it occurred.
On 02/14/2025 an in-person conversation was held with
Complainant. No additional concerns were noted.
On 02/18/2025 a telephone call was made to DHHS Specialist to
discuss the plan for initiating the investigation. She also advised
that Youth A was interviewed on 2/15/2025 by DHHS Specialist 2
and he reported that Staff 1 punched him and slammed him to the
ground. He also reported he sustained an injury to his forehead
and arm. He denied that Staff 1 has ever hit him in the past or
that he has seen Staff 1 hit other youth.
On 02/18/202 an email was sent to FCW requesting a response
with any concerns for Youth A and his placement.
The following interviews were completed on 2/25/2025 at CCH
along with DHHS Specialist, unless otherwise noted.
2

Interview of Residential Coordinator (RC) was completed. She
provided a copy of the video footage for review and copies of the
incident reports. She advised that the incident would have
occurred in the youths room and there are no cameras there, but
video footage from the hallway is available. RC also clarified that
agency policy/practice at Christ Child House is for a staff member
to monitor outside the room when another staff enters a room
when a youth is.
Interview of Chief Administrator (CA) was completed. DHHS
Specialist discussed a safety plan with the CA regarding Staff 1
until the investigation is complete. CA reported that Staff 1 may
“goof off a little with the youth” but denied any concerns for him
regarding interactions with the youth. She has never witnessed
him being aggressive or putting his hands on any of the youth.
She reported Staff 1 has worked for CCH for approximately five
years.
Another interview of Youth A was completed. He was asked
about the incident that occurred between himself and Staff 1.
Youth A stated he was being defiant, and Staff 1 wanted to keep
him safe. Youth A reported that he was mad and was throwing his
stuff at staff. Youth A denied that Staff 1 shoved, pushed, hit,
punched, or kicked him. He reported that he said Staff 1 did those
things because he was mad. When asked about the bruise on his
face and arm that he reported and showed to the other DHHS
workers, Youth A stated he did not remember how he received the
bruises. I asked Youth A if he remembered talking to me when I
was at the agency on 2/14/2025 when he reported Staff 1 hit him
and he stated yes. He stated that he made that up because he
was mad at Youth A. He stated Staff 1 did not hit/punch him or
shove him on the floor. He reported that everything was good
between he and Staff 1. Youth A denied hearing Staff 1 call youth
at the agency names and denied knowledge of Staff 1 hitting or
shoving other youth.
Interview of Youth B was completed. He was asked if anything
happened at Christ Child House that he felt should not happen,
and he stated that the staff make inappropriate remarks including
calling youth names. He further reported that staff make up rules
to extend youth's time in placement and they will take away
privileges like outings. Youth B reported that staff call him names
and use inappropriate language. He was unable to give specific
names of staff that engage in the reported behavior. Youth B
stated Staff 1 called him a snitch for talking about the incident that
3

happened with Youth A. Youth B also reported that Staff 1 says,
"you can’t wipe your own ass" and expanded that to mean he
doesn’t clean up after himself. Youth B stated
he was aware of an incident between Youth A and Staff 1. He
reported that two staff members kept Youth A in the hallway in a
restraint position and he heard Youth A yelling to staff to “stop
hitting me”. He denied that he was able to observe what was
going on in Youth A’s room.
Interview of Staff 1 was completed. He was advised of the
allegations involving Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1 reported that
Youth A was upset about not getting the shower stall he wanted
and became escalated. Staff 1 was called to assist and he stated
he attempted to deescalate Youth A. Staff 1 stated he was
successful in escorting Youth A back to his room, but he remained
upset. Youth A started throwing books and other items at staff.
Staff 1 stated for everyone’s safety, he guided Youth A to the
bedroom next to his own as it was unoccupied and only included a
dresser and bed. Staff 1 denied hitting or pushing Youth A and
further denied engaging with him in an aggressive manner. He
confirmed that he guided him to the other room by grabbing his
hand and wrist and leading him into the room. He denied using
restraints or inappropriate language with Youth A or any other
youth at Christ Child House. Staff 1 did admit the use of playful
nicknames for some of the youth in an attempt to build
relationships with them. He denied that the nicknames are
negative, demeaning or threatening in nature. He also indicated
he would refrain from using those names if asked by the youth to
do so. Staff 1 denied saying "wipe your own ass" in any way to a
youth. He denied intentionally escalating youth or encouraging
them to become escalated. He reported that he tries to keep the
environment calm. He reported that his relationship with Youth A
varies based on the mood of Youth A but feels like they have a
good working relationship. Staff 1 denied putting his hands on
Youth A or any youth placed at Child Christ House. He further
stated that he believed Youth A got the bruise from an incident
when he hit his head and said an incident report was completed.
Staff 1 reported he also had a good relationship with Youth B. He
denied calling him a snitch or telling the youth that they are not
cool. Staff 1 denied calling any of the youth names, bullying, or
being physically aggressive with them.
On 03/10/2025 a telephone interview was completed with Staff 3.
He reported that he has been employed at Christ Child House for
over 9 years. He confirmed that he was on staff on 2/13/2025 and
recalled the incident involving Youth A and Staff 1. He stated that
4

Youth A was throwing objects from his room into the hallway and
tearing his room up. He also stated that Youth A was cursing and
being irate. Staff 1 asked Youth A to stop and he refused. Staff 1
took Youth A by the hand/wrist and guided him into room next to
his bedroom as it contained a bed and dresser with no other items
for Youth A to throw at staff or into the hallway. Staff 3 denied
observing Staff 1 punching, pushing, or shoving Youth A during
this incident or at any time. He denied observing Staff 1 being
physically aggressive with any youth. Staff 3 also denied
knowledge of Staff 1 or any staff using profanity toward youth at
the agency. He stated that Staff 1 has a good relationship with
the youth at the agency.
The following interviews were completed on 3/10/2025 at CCH
by DHHS Specialist, unless otherwise noted. I participated in
the interviews via telephone.
Interview of Youth C was completed. He refused to come to the
conference room, so the interview was completed at a picnic table
outside. Youth C denied remembering speaking with me in the
past. He reported that Staff 1 was “cool” and denied ever seeing
or hearing Staff 1 hit, push, or curse toward youth at the agency.
Interview of Staff 2 was completed. She stated that she was on
shift when the incident occurred with Youth A. She recalled that
Staff 1 walked Youth A to an empty room and she heard Youth A
screaming "I don't want to be here, and I hate it here." She stated
that when she looked in the room, Staff 1 was standing several
feet from Youth A. She continued to walk down the hall and heard
Youth A continuing to scream and yell. She denied observing
anything that was concerning or against agency policy. She
denied seeing Youth A being hit or shoved by Staff 1 or any other
staff. She also denied hearing Staff 1 speaking negatively toward
youth at the agency. She acknowledged that Staff 1 and the
youth will sometimes joke with each other, but it is never in a
negative way.
Interview of Staff 4 was completed. She confirmed that she
recalled the incident involving Youth A on 2/13/25. She reported
Staff 1 came and took Youth A to his room to let him calm down.
She stated she left the floor to do something else, but when she
returned she saw Youth A was in the room located right next door
to his. She reported that this room contained a bed and a dresser
and that Staff 1 was sitting in a chair outside of the room. Youth A
remained upset and began attempting to pick up the bed and
harm himself, thus the items were removed from the room. She
5

denied observing Staff 1 put his hands on Youth A in an
aggressive or inappropriate manner. She denied observing Staff 1
push, shove, or punch Youth A. She denied any issues with the
interaction of Staff 1 with youth at the agency. She lastly denied
knowledge of Staff 1 calling youth out of their names or cursing at
them.
On 03/13/2025 a DHHS Case Conference was held via Video
Conference. DHHS Specialist advised of no findings.
Video Review:
Multiple staff members were observed to be standing outside of
Youth A’s room. They were identified as Staff 2 and Staff 3. They
appear to be observing the actions of Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 1
is observed taking Youth A from one room to another room which
is right next to the original room. Staff 1 is seen guiding Youth A
into the other room with his hand on the shoulder of Youth A.
Staff 3 is watching. Staff 1 is then seen bringing out a small
cardboard box and metal fan from the room. He sets the fan up
and sits in the computer chair positioned outside the room. Staff 2
is seen walking by the room and looking into the room. There is
no footage of activity inside of the room. The video lasts about 10
minutes.
Documents Reviewed:
Christ Child House Discipline & Behavior Management Policy:
Policy indicates to ensure that resident’s rights are protected, and
that service is provided in a manner consistent with best practice
standards outlined here, behavior support guidelines established
by CCH specifically prohibits the use of restrictive or otherwise
unacceptable actions by staff members, including but not limited
to the following criteria examples:
1. Corporal punishment by any staff.
2. Physical abuse or verbal abuse of residents by staff.
3. Fear eliciting/aversive or any other restrictive/intrusive
consequences.
Incident Reports:
CCH Incident Report dated 2/13/2025 indicated that Youth A was
upset about being told no about the use of a certain shower. It
was documented that Youth A was being very aggressive towards
staff, slamming the bed down on the floor, and hitting the wall with
the bed. The bed was removed by staff and Youth A continued to
be aggressive and attempted to break the window. Staff attempted
to deescalate youth. He sat on the floor and was observed crying
6

saying that he missed his family. He eventually calmed down and
stated he was ready for his shower and bed.
CCH Incident Report dated 02/10/2025 documented an altercation
between Youth A and Youth C. Staff intervened and the youth
were separated. Supervision was notified that Youth A got a knot
on his head. He declined the need for medical attention.
CCH Employee Behavior and Discipline Report
Report noted that Staff 1 was provided with a verbal warning and
written confirmation due to excessive instances of tardiness and
absences. Report is dated 1/30/2025
Tour of Agency:
On 2/25/2025 a tour of the area of the concern was reviewed by
myself and DHHS Specialist. It was noted that the second room
utilized to remove Youth A from his room is located right next to
his bedroom. No areas of concern were noted.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. Both youth and staff were
interviewed and there was no evidence to suggest a violation of
the licensing rule.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
